definition: bad temper
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost
spleen
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: He had cleared off his ill-humour at Randalls.
sentences.chinese: 他已經在蘭得爾清除了他的壞脾氣。

sentences.english: Some bad-tempered members shouted at the chairman during the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 一些壞脾氣的會員在會議期間向主席叫喊。

sentences.english: But bilious outbursts and business success often go hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 但壞脾氣往往與商業上的成功並肩而行。

sentences.english: Dad, I since the childhood to you are filled with hate, I hate you the flip-side of bad temper.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸我從小對你充滿怨恨，我討厭你那暴躁的壞脾氣。

sentences.english: Mr Jobs has shared his spleen around over the years.
sentences.chinese: 喬布斯的壞脾氣年頭已經不小。

sentences.english: Are you living with a grumpy spouse or partner?
sentences.chinese: 你在和壞脾氣的配偶或情人生活在一起嗎？

sentences.english: His bad temper chased his friends away.
sentences.chinese: 他的壞脾氣使朋友們都離他而去。

sentences.english: I will keep my ill-humour to myself.
sentences.chinese: 我會剋制住我的壞脾氣的。

sentences.english: Paradoxically, voters' grumpiness may be a spur for radical change.
sentences.chinese: 矛盾的是，選民的壞脾氣可能激發根本的變革。

sentences.english: The cantankerous bus driver rouse on the children for singing.
sentences.chinese: 那個壞脾氣的公共汽車司機因爲孩子們唱歌而罵他們。

sentences.english: She attributed  his bad temper to ill health.
sentences.chinese: 她把他的壞脾氣歸咎於健康不佳。

sentences.english: She coaxed him out of his bad temper.
sentences.chinese: 她循循善誘地勸他改掉壞脾氣。

sentences.english: My bad temper, you asks, but already knows.
sentences.chinese: 我的壞脾氣，你明知故問。

sentences.english: What food easy cause bad temper?
sentences.chinese: 哪些食物易引起壞脾氣？

sentences.english: He had a temper as bad as a bull.
sentences.chinese: 他有着公牛一樣的壞脾氣。

sentences.english: But unfortunately he had his failings too: laziness and a love of tippling .
sentences.chinese: 可惜他又有一樣壞脾氣，便是好喝懶做。

definition: to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to be in a bad mood
to turn a blind eye
pinyin: zheng1 yi1 zhi1 yan3 bi4 yi1 zhi1 yan3

definition: to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
brazen
to go into a huff
to exercise forbearance/patient and accommodating
to spoil (a child etc)
to cool one's temper
to argue/to reason with sb/to talk sense/to be reasonable
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
docile and obedient/all obedience
crafty and unruly
